website_summaries.verdict: Aluminum heats up quickly, so you can start steaming dozens of tamales quickly. The pot might not work well for purposes other than steaming, though.
pros: Remove the insert and it can be used as a stock pot
Use for tamales, lobster, mussels, and corn on the cob
cons: Made of thinner metal that makes it good for steaming tamales but not great as a stockpot

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY UNSAFE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This melted and burned on the first batch of tamales. I was unaware that I had melting mental on my stove and almost caused a fire. Unfortunately, it also ruined our dinner plans for the weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: What you need for Weber Mini WSM smoker build
customer_reviews.text: This is the pot you need for building the Weber Mini WSM smoker. 10/10 perfect fit. Makes delicious barbecue!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Savage

customer_reviews.title: Warped the first use
customer_reviews.text: The bottom warped the first time I steamed a batch of tamales. The pan was not dry or on HIGH heat. It was on medium and the water was checked every 15 minutes. Also the pot is completely discolored after 1 use. Kind of weird.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Nobrega

customer_reviews.title: Reserving full judgement for later , but....
customer_reviews.text: *Update. 9/2020. Started putting after a few uses. One year later now it is unusable. Whole bottom pitted. -All the reviews I read saying it was damaged or bottom wasn't flat. Mine arrived in tact, double boxed. Maybe they changed the packaging??? I'll reserve full judgement until I use it, as some reviews say it is too thin and developed pin holes or rust. But as far as delivery goes, I have found nothing wrong. Arrived in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: P. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: I used this to make a "smoker" out of my ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to make a "smoker" out of my small "Smokey Joe" (Weber) grill - cut an "H" out of the bottom, folded the base up so it would hold a plant base (as a grease catch) - 3 #5 small bolts around the top to set the grill on - and the Smokey Joe lid fits PERFECTLY on top of the steamer pot.
customer_reviews.author: CZWDSTCK

customer_reviews.title: Small pot but great for soups and small tamale batches
customer_reviews.text: For tamales, the 12qt pot is a bit small unless you are only trying to make smaller batches. We can cook around 30 tamales at a time, I would consider these average thickness. If you made them smaller you could fit more than 30. Came with a steamer plate for the tamales to rest on above the water. Lid is simple and does not have any venting options if you need them. Also makes a great soup pot. If you are buying this for tamales, strongly consider the larger size or you might end up with two sized pots instead of one.
customer_reviews.author: DGEntertainment808

customer_reviews.title: Received blemished/ update
customer_reviews.text: Received the pot, but it already had a dent in the cover. :-(( All else so far looks ok. Used the pot with water at 155 degrees Fahrenheit overnight with sous vide heating element. I noticed the pot appears to shed gray coloring on my white plastic scrub brush. May not be good for putting food items directly into this pot.
customer_reviews.author: Covalent crema

customer_reviews.title: Great tamale pot
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this tamale pan. It's not very heavy at all but that's ok with me. It did clean up ok but has left water like stains which is fine. I didn't expect it to be shiny looking after use. It steamed tamales very good and I have used it for a seafood boil we had. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with the lid bent. It’s the most flimsy pot. If I squeeze it I’m sure I can bend the entire thing. I get that you get what you pay for but this is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

customer_reviews.title: Mini wsm
customer_reviews.text: August 12, 2019- Bought this for a mini Weber smokey joe build. Mine was made in china, and fit couldnt b more perfect. Hopefully it stays that way when its hot
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love it!! I saw this same pot at jcpennys for almost double the price. I wanted it to bad that I looked it up on Amazon and here it is for a great price. I cooked in it for the first time last night and it turned out great! And it cleaned up so well, it wasn't difficult at all, nothing stuck to the pan which was great too!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie dagostino

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: I used this pot to cook three dozen tamales at work on a Coleman outdoor grill for a Friday lunch. It took only thee minutes for the water to boil and the pot was great in heating them in a short time. Did not take much to clean up and was great to carry the utensils afterward. my next project is to try some cajun food in it.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: I put this pot on the stove to boil the water and the pot itself started bouncing back and forth from the heat. The middle of the pot swelled up and was moving back and forth on the stove. I took the pot off and threw it away!!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS POT!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Adderley

customer_reviews.title: The bottom burnt out
customer_reviews.text: We bought this pot to steam crabs. Looked good, but it’s a piece of crap. Didn’t get a dozen crabs cooked before the bottom burnt away and drained all the liquid. It’s too light of a gauge aluminum for outdoor propane cookers. The crabs cost more than the cooker and half of them were burnt.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mashack

customer_reviews.title: perfect size
customer_reviews.text: this was a replacement for a larger style. this pot is perfect for storage and holds a lot of tamales or other items. no need to reduce the quantity. nice finish packaged well would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Larry sayles

customer_reviews.title: A great steamer
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the steamer this one replaced, this steamer is shorter and wider. I found this feature advantageous when steaming artichokes. However, like all steamers, one must be sure not to let all of the water get used up. I use a timer and add water every 20-30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C. Avakoff

customer_reviews.title: Great pot
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally bought a huge one but really it hasn't disappointed even with a small batch! And now if I have a tamale party I have the perfect pot 😂
customer_reviews.author: S. price

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Smokey Joe
customer_reviews.text: I have never used this pot as a steamer. But if you are planning on making a smoker out of this pot and a weber joe silver, you will be very pleased. It fits like a glove, and the ring that was designed to hold the steamer grate will hold the grill rack for the joe perfectly. It is also very easy to drill the smoke holes, but watch out those metal shavings are sharp. Sorry everyone who wants to use this as a steamer, as intended. This review isn't helpful for you, but if you are a DIY BBQ guy, then this thing works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: I. Mullis

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: I was not too happy the first time I used this the bottom popped out and now it has a bubble bottom aka unsturdy bottom and doesn't cook evenly😢
customer_reviews.author: JESSICA DOCKSTADER

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, steel does stain.
customer_reviews.text: It did it’s job, however as you see on the picture it stained after I washed it and it won’t come off. Really doubt it will affect the steamers job to make tamales. It just looks yucky now lol
customer_reviews.author: gabriela mata-marquez

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy it again at this price, it requires some modification prior to use
customer_reviews.text: The holes in the steam plate are too small and don’t allow the heat to properly flow
customer_reviews.author: MortizzO

customer_reviews.title: Highly Disappointec
customer_reviews.text: Highly disappointed. Pan is good, steamer insert good, cover lid was all bent around the edge and will not fit securely on pot. Will have to go buy separate lid for it now.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great for tamales
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect for making tamales. It’s also a good price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy R. Neys

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this so my sister and I could make tamales for the family. It arrived later than originally informed (I'm sure the weather had something to do with it) and when I did receive it, there was a dent on the bottom of the pan. I opted not to return it as it's "just a pot", but still, not really happy that it arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: It came bent and the lid isn’t very secure, but for the price there’s not much to complain about. It’s a good “starter” do not expect major quality.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Brenes

customer_reviews.title: This is am great deal, a good pot and steamer
customer_reviews.text: I 8use this for steaming clams, corn and of coarse, tamales. Easy to use steams well easy to clean and will hold up well, this is my 2nd as I gave one to my ex-wife. I like this pot and steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J Salls

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: After the first use , color started to “darken” like cheap material .
customer_reviews.author: sonia

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in August my package was lost and didn't receive it until September. Since it took so long to arrive I kept it in the box since I had no use for it at that time since I received it late. Well lo and behold now that I go to use it I notice it has 2 holes and it leaks. I have many other of this stock pots in various sizes & I had never had an issue until now. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dayana

customer_reviews.title: recommended
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed for tamales. They came out great
customer_reviews.author: Brandon & Jessica mcgowen

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I like it it works but the first time you use it inside changes colors to a whitish that doesn't wash off it's the aluminum changing colors from the steam.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Martinez

customer_reviews.title: but other than that I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Came slightly deformed/bent so the top doesn't sit perfectly on top, but other than that I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jolaiz84

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This pot burn after 30 min of on the stove. Please don’t waste your money. It’s Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Gray

customer_reviews.title: Cam damaged.
customer_reviews.text: My pot came smashed in the side. The kid wouldn’t even fit on it and I can’t get the huge dent out if it.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as 24 and I assumed 24 qt. Me bad. Read before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: greg graves

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: This item is very poor quality, I’m very disappointed by the material and descriptions of the pot. I used it twice only and looks totally ruin. I wished the window time to return it was more flexible.
customer_reviews.author: David Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality however, I purchased this specifically to steam tamales and that's all I can ask for. Overall, good quality and works but disappointed my lid has a minor bend.
customer_reviews.author: Keshia Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Perfect size for me. I only make 2-3 dozen tamales at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Big pot
customer_reviews.text: It’s too big for me but it’s great for a person with a very large family
customer_reviews.author: Lenabey

customer_reviews.title: Great pot
customer_reviews.text: Great pot for tamales when you need to cook about 30-40
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It a good pot
customer_reviews.text: I needed a steamer pot and this was the perfect size for me. Good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Victor Razo

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good investment
customer_reviews.text: First things first, this thing is HUGE!!! I use it for steaming dumplings and seafood and I never have a concern if it will all fit. It heats up quickly and I'm not really concerned about any possibly of it breaking. There are a few minor drawbacks. The aluminum construction, while heating up quickly (aluminum has a low specific heat and transfers heat quickly, that's why radiators and heatsinks are made from it) discolors with repeated heat cycles. The brushed surface can be tricky to keep clean. Besides that, there's nothing really bad about it. If you're not really concerned with looks and you just want a huge steamer to make some awesome food, this is a sure shot.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to clean and if you've never used one before it's easy to use. I made the best tamales in this.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Hyde (Arsola)

customer_reviews.title: Warped lid and small indentation on rim
customer_reviews.text: The lid had several small indentation and was warped. The good thing is, if your patient and strong enough to work the lid back to proper shape you can. The little indentations on rim remained. Other than that it is a nice little pot. Probably can fit couple dozen tamales if you place them right.
customer_reviews.author: jorge Saldana

customer_reviews.title: Tamale Steamer
customer_reviews.text: Making Tamales this weekend for Christmas and received my pan with the lid bent 😩😩😩 but I do like the pan other than that...my husband is gonna try to straighten out lid .... pan seems durable but lid is just thin aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Too lite weight.
customer_reviews.text: Very lite weight will only use to soak the husk at Very low temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price!! The pot is thin so it might not hold up to heavy use. I purchased two of them to make a vacuum filter for maple syrup which would be atypical for their use.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: For what I bought it for it works great and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: P. Pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in a damaged pot.
customer_reviews.text: The pan was ok. However, was damaged and dented up when it arrived. There was no protection or anything to keep it from getting damaged. I was very disappointed. Last I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie ledesma

customer_reviews.title: Seems very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This is what you would expect for a aluminium pot however, the lid came dented and doesn't fit right. Also when using it my burner shape is now burned into the bottom after the forst use. If i didn't need it right away i would have returned it and got a different one.
customer_reviews.author: mary schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this specifically for steaming blue crabs Maryland style, with vinegar, water, beer and lots of Old Bay seasoning. Three batches later, it's performed and cleaned up just great. Twenty-one crabs last time fit with room to spare. An excellent buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Consumer

customer_reviews.title: It’s awesome
customer_reviews.text: First time making homemade tamales and this pot was the best and I have an electric stove with a glass cook top and it didn’t destroy the top.
customer_reviews.author: Buffie Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan
customer_reviews.text: Love this pan. So many uses. Has a non stick coating that make it a breeze to clean. Love the colors it comes in. Plan to buy another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: R. Poole

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good product:( so thin very poorly made
customer_reviews.author: petplacepalacehome

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy !
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i was looking for and what i needed to make great tamales !
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used once for tamales and the bottom burnt a little bit but it worked great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only good for one use.
customer_reviews.text: We used the pot once and after washing it the inside of the pot is peeling. It looks as if we’ve had this pot for years.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Product buckled/bent in the bottom.
customer_reviews.text: Product looked sturdy and steamed the tamales ok but it buckled on the bottom to the point that it was unusable and had to throw it away!
customer_reviews.author: Hope Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Thin material
customer_reviews.text: Works good. The aluminum material seems really thin though, I'll see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Egresites

customer_reviews.title: One and done
customer_reviews.text: After using it one time, the pot is black and I can’t get rid of the black tarnish
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan M. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Nope no no
customer_reviews.text: Used once on low and the whole bottom was toasted!
customer_reviews.author: Cathlin Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: tamale time
customer_reviews.text: I never could find a pot large enough for a decent price. great value
customer_reviews.author: tom nelson

customer_reviews.title: primarily bought and used for canning homemade enchilada sauce.
customer_reviews.text: primarily bought and used for canning homemade enchilada sauce. will work for any canning or just big pots of cooking goodness
customer_reviews.author: Cross U

customer_reviews.title: Great pot!
customer_reviews.text: Great pot to make tamales in! A bit small but for 3 people was enough!
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Torres

customer_reviews.title: Perfect steamer pot for southern homes
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews on this item, I was a little nervous to purchase it. I recently moved south and theres tons of fresh seafood begging to be steamed so I gave it a try. To my surprise, I found alot of the reviews to be incorrect in my opinion. I absolutely love this pot, it steamed 12 large male blue crab to perfection and was a very easy clean up. The only trouble I have is finding a place to put this as its HUGE! Love the pot and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Kayle Ealey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works well it's a great pan its big but get the all over. love it!
customer_reviews.author: Donna W

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!!
customer_reviews.text: This size makes it super easy and convenient to heat up tamales and steam food!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Loved everything about it. My only complaint was that I didn’t order a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Catalano

customer_reviews.title: Imusa Steamer Pot, Aluminum, 32-Quart
customer_reviews.text: If you love crabs like I do there is no way you can go wrong buy getting this nice steamer pot, I love it and the price cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Steamer Pot for Tamales
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pot once for tamales. I had 5 dozen in the pot and was only about 3/4 of the way packed. I look forward to using this pot again in a couple of more weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used this pot to make a Smokey Joe Smoker. It worked well.
customer_reviews.author: MrTim

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: After using the pot to seam Maryland Blue Crabs 2 dozen times over 2 years, the bottom developed a hole. Not a pinhole, but a hole big enough to put your thumb through. Poor casing/manufacturing flaw. 8/19/2013
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Mine Worked For a Mini WSM
customer_reviews.text: As stated before there are two countries where this is manufactured. China which will fit on a Smokey Joe grill, and Columbia where it will not. Mine was made in China and fit, but with Amazon's multi warehouse distribution network you are probably taking a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a little bit thinner than what I think it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Paul P.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was missing the screw to attach the handle to the lid
customer_reviews.author: Michele Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Tamale steamer
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product and would recommend it for anyone wanting to steam tamales. It is the perfect size for the amount that I make and did a wonderful job of steaming them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need for the Weber Smokey Joe smoker conversion
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made steamer that I bought to convert the Smokey Joe into a smoker. It's exactly the right size!
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: pot
customer_reviews.text: I used it to make a smoker with my weber. Fit great on my weber gold. I do not know how it works for its real purpose
customer_reviews.author: nopenname

customer_reviews.title: BEST BANG FOR THE BUCK
customer_reviews.text: This pot is perfect steaming King Crab legs without having to break them. The gauge is not the thickest but this is a steamer pot not a stock pot so it doesn't have to be.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Foubister

customer_reviews.title: Handles Leaked.
customer_reviews.text: If you have any intention of using these pots in an application that requires you to take the water level past the handle rivets (which is about 12 quarts for the 20 quart version) purchase a different pot. I ordered two and both of them arrived with leaky handle rivets. They seem to be decent pots otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Zymurjay

customer_reviews.title: Cooks crabs
customer_reviews.text: Cook crabs, all I ask for. Throw in a few ears of corn and you've got a feast!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Woodsum

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the lesser money
customer_reviews.text: Lid was damaged in shipping. I upgraded to another brand and went with Stainless steel, and a basket for $20 more. Worth the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: R. Coonce

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: The lid was dented pretty bad, but I was able to straighten it out for the most part. The pot itself has several dents in it as well. I would look to improve the packaging for this item, even if that means a slight increase in shipping charges. For what I am using it for the pot works perfect, but someone who is concerned with appearance may have requested a refund.
customer_reviews.author: DonPritch

customer_reviews.title: Then the process to claim it sucked. Lesson learned
customer_reviews.text: I am sure it would have been ok if it had not been run over by a Mack Truck. Then the process to claim it sucked. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas F.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: I love tamales...home made tamales. When I was working the local "Tamale ladies" used to come by the office and sell us traditional Mexican tamales (these ladies were from Mexico). Still warm, OMG they were to die for and I never have been able to find even a "traditional" Mexican restaurant that could match those. I bought this well made steamer which has other purposes too hoping I can duplicate those amazing "Tamale Lady" tamales.
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: Great size, fits on stove.
customer_reviews.text: Very straightforward product. Used it to make me first batch of tamales by myself after moving away from home. It fit about 90 tamales when stacked right. This will vary on how large you make them. Very good size. I don’t think a larger sizw would have fit on my electric stove. Good price too.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena

customer_reviews.title: My goto pot for big jobs on the stovetop.
customer_reviews.text: It's big, attractive, cooks well, the clear tight-sealing lid is a plus, and really easy to clean, A huge bargain, I prefer it to pots that cost far more. The handles get hot, and the temptation to grab them is strong, so I stick a silicon hotpad over the closer handle when I use it on the stove. This has become my favorite big skillet/kettle/braiser. I reach for it first when I have to make something big on the stovetop. see less
customer_reviews.author: Taryntoo

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price, I guess
customer_reviews.text: For $20 kettle, I had some pretty low expectations. But this seemed to have quality higher than that. I wanted to try making tamales without pouring tons of money into it, in case it becomes a one-time thing. This seemed to fit that need nicely. If I do it more often, I'll buy a better one. This one will work fine in the interim. Pros —The handles look sturdy —Some half-decent thickness Cons —The lid handle had no insulation and therefore gets extremely hot —The bottom bows outward and the whole pot does a hilarious dance as it heats up
customer_reviews.author: Todd Ruehmer

customer_reviews.title: Great size for canning
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I needed a pot for canning that was taller than the typical granite wear. I was always boiling over with quarts because I had to have it so full to cover by the required 1" of water. I can even can juice in my half gallon jars with this pot. First one arrived without rack. Amazon offered to discount it, but without a rack I couldn't use it so I requested a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: pot not too good
customer_reviews.text: We used this pot to steam tamales in only. We washed the pot and by just putting water in the pot. It turned black in the inside up to the water level. This will not come out. It is there to stay. I do not like this at all. I would like a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Garner

customer_reviews.title: My new crab pot
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be perfect to steam blue crab or lobster, I was shocked it was that big made my day!!
customer_reviews.author: denise izumi

customer_reviews.title: Stained aluminum or Used?
customer_reviews.text: The steamer has been either used or the manufacturing quality is extremely poor with the aluminum showing large stains. See attached images. Returning item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tamales Time!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, bought this to steam my tamales and it does the job perfectly! Sturdy material, definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Tamale cooker
customer_reviews.text: Great pot for the price. Ordered it to steam and cook Tamales. Looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Braun

customer_reviews.title: Weber mini smokey mountain
customer_reviews.text: You can get the same thing from walmart for a few dollars less other than that it's going to work great for my weber mini smokey mountain
customer_reviews.author: Bushcrafter87

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Made my tamales easy to steam Fits about 25-30 tamales
customer_reviews.author: Gina Key

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money. Thin metal which caused discoloration. But does not affect the usefulness
customer_reviews.author: NTRS

customer_reviews.title: Totally love the pot & steamer piece
customer_reviews.text: Totally love the pot & steamer piece. My only issue is that the lid did not completely lay flat on the pot which kind of hinders the whole concept of steaming!
customer_reviews.author: Bristol

customer_reviews.title: Easy to cook with
customer_reviews.text: This pot had dents in it when it arrived, but I didn’t have time to exchange it. Needed it the next day, but it still works
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarie Mensah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a smoker
customer_reviews.text: This pot was promptly cut and used as part of a mini smoker. A Weber mini grill lid fits perfectly on top.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great wort pot
customer_reviews.text: Boils faster than my friend's stainless pot. Great for making beer in. I ended buying a larger aluminum pot as well. If your worried about aluminum and beer, don't. Just do a water boil or two and scrub it good. *be careful dumping it out, don't spill it on your foot like I did, nasty burn.
customer_reviews.author: Jake
